element.name: Segment
element.documentation: The Root Element that contains all other Top-Level Elements (Elements defined only at Level 1). A Matroska file is composed of 1 Segment.

element.name: SeekHead
element.documentation: Contains the position of other Top-Level Elements.

element.name: Seek
element.documentation: Contains a single seek entry to an EBML Element.

element.name: SeekID
element.documentation: The binary ID corresponding to the Element name.

element.name: SeekPosition
element.documentation: The position of the Element in the Segment in octets (0 = first level 1 Element).

element.name: Info
element.documentation: Contains general information about the Segment.

element.name: SegmentUID
element.documentation: A randomly generated unique ID to identify the current Segment between many others (128 bits).

element.name: SegmentFilename
element.documentation: A filename corresponding to this Segment.

element.name: PrevUID
element.documentation: A unique ID to identify the previous Linked Segment (128 bits).

element.name: PrevFilename
element.documentation: A filename corresponding to the file of the previous Linked Segment.
Provision of the previous filename is for display convenience, but PrevUID should be considered authoritative for identifying the previous Segment in a Linked Segment.

element.name: NextUID
element.documentation: A unique ID to identify the next Linked Segment (128 bits).

element.name: NextFilename
element.documentation: A filename corresponding to the file of the next Linked Segment.
Provision of the next filename is for display convenience, but NextUID should be considered authoritative for identifying the Next Segment.

element.name: SegmentFamily
element.documentation: A randomly generated unique ID that all Segments related to each other must use (128 bits).

element.name: ChapterTranslate
element.documentation: A tuple of corresponding ID used by chapter codecs to represent this Segment.

element.name: ChapterTranslateEditionUID
element.documentation: Specify an edition UID on which this correspondance applies. When not specified, it means for all editions found in the Segment.

element.name: ChapterTranslateCodec
element.documentation: The chapter codec using this ID (0: Matroska Script, 1: DVD-menu).

element.name: ChapterTranslateID
element.documentation: The binary value used to represent this Segment in the chapter codec data. The format depends on the ChapProcessCodecID used.

element.name: TimecodeScale
element.documentation: Timestamp scale in nanoseconds (1.000.000 means all timestamps in the Segment are expressed in milliseconds).

element.name: Duration
element.documentation: Duration of the Segment (based on TimecodeScale).

element.name: DateUTC
element.documentation: Date of the origin of timestamp (value 0), i.e. production date.

element.name: Title
element.documentation: General name of the Segment.

element.name: MuxingApp
element.documentation: Muxing application or library ("libmatroska-0.4.3").

element.name: WritingApp
element.documentation: Writing application ("mkvmerge-0.3.3").

element.name: Cluster
element.documentation: The Top-Level Element containing the (monolithic) Block structure.

element.name: Timecode
element.documentation: Absolute timestamp of the cluster (based on TimecodeScale).

element.name: SilentTracks
element.documentation: The list of tracks that are not used in that part of the stream. It is useful when using overlay tracks on seeking. Then you should decide what track to use.

element.name: SilentTrackNumber
element.documentation: One of the track number that are not used from now on in the stream. It could change later if not specified as silent in a further Cluster.

element.name: Position
element.documentation: The Position of the Cluster in the Segment (0 in live broadcast streams). It might help to resynchronise offset on damaged streams.

element.name: PrevSize
element.documentation: Size of the previous Cluster, in octets. Can be useful for backward playing.

element.name: SimpleBlock
element.documentation: Similar to Block but without all the extra information, mostly used to reduced overhead when no extra feature is needed. (see SimpleBlock Structure)

element.name: BlockGroup
element.documentation: Basic container of information containing a single Block or BlockVirtual, and information specific to that Block/VirtualBlock.

element.name: Block
element.documentation: Block containing the actual data to be rendered and a timestamp relative to the Cluster Timecode. (see Block Structure)

element.name: BlockVirtual
element.documentation: A Block with no data. It must be stored in the stream at the place the real Block should be in display order. (see Block Virtual)

element.name: BlockAdditions
element.documentation: Contain additional blocks to complete the main one. An EBML parser that has no knowledge of the Block structure could still see and use/skip these data.

element.name: BlockMore
element.documentation: Contain the BlockAdditional and some parameters.

element.name: BlockAddID
element.documentation: An ID to identify the BlockAdditional level.

element.name: BlockAdditional
element.documentation: Interpreted by the codec as it wishes (using the BlockAddID).

element.name: BlockDuration
element.documentation: The duration of the Block (based on TimecodeScale). This Element is mandatory when DefaultDuration is set for the track (but can be omitted as other default values). When not written and with no DefaultDuration, the value is assumed to be the difference between the timestamp of this Block and the timestamp of the next Block in "display" order (not coding order). This Element can be useful at the end of a Track (as there is not other Block available), or when there is a break in a track like for subtitle tracks. When set to 0 that means the frame is not a keyframe.

element.name: ReferencePriority
element.documentation: This frame is referenced and has the specified cache priority. In cache only a frame of the same or higher priority can replace this frame. A value of 0 means the frame is not referenced.

element.name: ReferenceBlock
element.documentation: Timestamp of another frame used as a reference (ie: B or P frame). The timestamp is relative to the block it's attached to.

element.name: ReferenceVirtual
element.documentation: Relative position of the data that should be in position of the virtual block.

element.name: CodecState
element.documentation: The new codec state to use. Data interpretation is private to the codec. This information should always be referenced by a seek entry.

element.name: DiscardPadding
element.documentation: Duration in nanoseconds of the silent data added to the Block (padding at the end of the Block for positive value, at the beginning of the Block for negative value). The duration of DiscardPadding is not calculated in the duration of the TrackEntry and should be discarded during playback.

element.name: Slices
element.documentation: Contains slices description.

element.name: TimeSlice
element.documentation: Contains extra time information about the data contained in the Block. While there are a few files in the wild with this Element, it is no longer in use and has been deprecated. Being able to interpret this Element is not required for playback.

element.name: LaceNumber
element.documentation: The reverse number of the frame in the lace (0 is the last frame, 1 is the next to last, etc). While there are a few files in the wild with this Element, it is no longer in use and has been deprecated. Being able to interpret this Element is not required for playback.

element.name: FrameNumber
element.documentation: The number of the frame to generate from this lace with this delay (allow you to generate many frames from the same Block/Frame).

element.name: BlockAdditionID
element.documentation: The ID of the BlockAdditional Element (0 is the main Block).

element.name: Delay
element.documentation: The (scaled) delay to apply to the Element.

element.name: SliceDuration
element.documentation: The (scaled) duration to apply to the Element.

element.name: EncryptedBlock
element.documentation: Similar to SimpleBlock but the data inside the Block are Transformed (encrypt and/or signed). (see EncryptedBlock Structure)

element.name: Tracks
element.documentation: A Top-Level Element of information with many tracks described.

element.name: TrackEntry
element.documentation: Describes a track with all Elements.

element.name: TrackNumber
element.documentation: The track number as used in the Block Header (using more than 127 tracks is not encouraged, though the design allows an unlimited number).

element.name: TrackUID
element.documentation: A unique ID to identify the Track. This should be kept the same when making a direct stream copy of the Track to another file.

element.name: TrackType
element.documentation: A set of track types coded on 8 bits (1: video, 2: audio, 3: complex, 0x10: logo, 0x11: subtitle, 0x12: buttons, 0x20: control).

element.name: FlagEnabled
element.documentation: Set if the track is usable. (1 bit)

element.name: FlagDefault
element.documentation: Set if that track (audio, video or subs) SHOULD be active if no language found matches the user preference. (1 bit)

element.name: FlagForced
element.documentation: Set if that track MUST be active during playback. There can be many forced track for a kind (audio, video or subs), the player should select the one which language matches the user preference or the default + forced track. Overlay MAY happen between a forced and non-forced track of the same kind. (1 bit)

element.name: FlagLacing
element.documentation: Set if the track may contain blocks using lacing. (1 bit)

element.name: MinCache
element.documentation: The minimum number of frames a player should be able to cache during playback. If set to 0, the reference pseudo-cache system is not used.

element.name: MaxCache
element.documentation: The maximum cache size required to store referenced frames in and the current frame. 0 means no cache is needed.

element.name: DefaultDuration
element.documentation: Number of nanoseconds (not scaled via TimecodeScale) per frame ('frame' in the Matroska sense -- one Element put into a (Simple)Block).

element.name: DefaultDecodedFieldDuration
element.documentation: The period in nanoseconds (not scaled by TimcodeScale) between two successive fields at the output of the decoding process (see the notes)

element.name: TrackTimecodeScale
element.documentation: DEPRECATED, DO NOT USE. The scale to apply on this track to work at normal speed in relation with other tracks (mostly used to adjust video speed when the audio length differs).

element.name: TrackOffset
element.documentation: A value to add to the Block's Timestamp. This can be used to adjust the playback offset of a track.

element.name: MaxBlockAdditionID
element.documentation: The maximum value of BlockAddID. A value 0 means there is no BlockAdditions for this track.

element.name: Name
element.documentation: A human-readable track name.

element.name: Language
element.documentation: Specifies the language of the track in the Matroska languages form.

element.name: CodecID
element.documentation: An ID corresponding to the codec, see the codec page for more info.

element.name: CodecPrivate
element.documentation: Private data only known to the codec.

element.name: CodecName
element.documentation: A human-readable string specifying the codec.

element.name: AttachmentLink
element.documentation: The UID of an attachment that is used by this codec.

element.name: CodecSettings
element.documentation: A string describing the encoding setting used.

element.name: CodecInfoURL
element.documentation: A URL to find information about the codec used.

element.name: CodecDownloadURL
element.documentation: A URL to download about the codec used.

element.name: CodecDecodeAll
element.documentation: The codec can decode potentially damaged data (1 bit).

element.name: TrackOverlay
element.documentation: Specify that this track is an overlay track for the Track specified (in the u-integer). That means when this track has a gap (see SilentTracks) the overlay track should be used instead. The order of multiple TrackOverlay matters, the first one is the one that should be used. If not found it should be the second, etc.

element.name: CodecDelay
element.documentation: CodecDelay is The codec-built-in delay in nanoseconds. This value must be subtracted from each block timestamp in order to get the actual timestamp. The value should be small so the muxing of tracks with the same actual timestamp are in the same Cluster.

element.name: SeekPreRoll
element.documentation: After a discontinuity, SeekPreRoll is the duration in nanoseconds of the data the decoder must decode before the decoded data is valid.

element.name: TrackTranslate
element.documentation: The track identification for the given Chapter Codec.

element.name: TrackTranslateEditionUID
element.documentation: Specify an edition UID on which this translation applies. When not specified, it means for all editions found in the Segment.

element.name: TrackTranslateCodec
element.documentation: The chapter codec using this ID (0: Matroska Script, 1: DVD-menu).

element.name: TrackTranslateTrackID
element.documentation: The binary value used to represent this track in the chapter codec data. The format depends on the ChapProcessCodecID used.

element.name: Video
element.documentation: Video settings.

element.name: FlagInterlaced
element.documentation: A flag to declare is the video is known to be progressive or interlaced and if applicable to declare details about the interlacement. (0: undetermined, 1: interlaced, 2: progressive)

element.name: FieldOrder
element.documentation: Declare the field ordering of the video. If FlagInterlaced is not set to 1, this Element MUST be ignored. (0: Progressive, 1: Interlaced with top field display first and top field stored first, 2: Undetermined field order, 6: Interlaced with bottom field displayed first and bottom field stored first, 9: Interlaced with bottom field displayed first and top field stored first, 14: Interlaced with top field displayed first and bottom field stored first)

element.name: StereoMode
element.documentation: Stereo-3D video mode (0: mono, 1: side by side (left eye is first), 2: top-bottom (right eye is first), 3: top-bottom (left eye is first), 4: checkboard (right is first), 5: checkboard (left is first), 6: row interleaved (right is first), 7: row interleaved (left is first), 8: column interleaved (right is first), 9: column interleaved (left is first), 10: anaglyph (cyan/red), 11: side by side (right eye is first), 12: anaglyph (green/magenta), 13 both eyes laced in one Block (left eye is first), 14 both eyes laced in one Block (right eye is first)) . There are some more details on 3D support in the Specification Notes.

element.name: AlphaMode
element.documentation: Alpha Video Mode. Presence of this Element indicates that the BlockAdditional Element could contain Alpha data.

element.name: OldStereoMode
element.documentation: DEPRECATED, DO NOT USE. Bogus StereoMode value used in old versions of libmatroska. (0: mono, 1: right eye, 2: left eye, 3: both eyes).

element.name: PixelWidth
element.documentation: Width of the encoded video frames in pixels.

element.name: PixelHeight
element.documentation: Height of the encoded video frames in pixels.

element.name: PixelCropBottom
element.documentation: The number of video pixels to remove at the bottom of the image (for HDTV content).

element.name: PixelCropTop
element.documentation: The number of video pixels to remove at the top of the image.

element.name: PixelCropLeft
element.documentation: The number of video pixels to remove on the left of the image.

element.name: PixelCropRight
element.documentation: The number of video pixels to remove on the right of the image.

element.name: DisplayWidth
element.documentation: Width of the video frames to display. Applies to the video frame after cropping (PixelCrop* Elements). The default value is only valid when DisplayUnit is 0.

element.name: DisplayHeight
element.documentation: Height of the video frames to display. Applies to the video frame after cropping (PixelCrop* Elements). The default value is only valid when DisplayUnit is 0.

element.name: DisplayUnit
element.documentation: How DisplayWidth & DisplayHeight should be interpreted (0: pixels, 1: centimeters, 2: inches, 3: Display Aspect Ratio).

element.name: AspectRatioType
element.documentation: Specify the possible modifications to the aspect ratio (0: free resizing, 1: keep aspect ratio, 2: fixed).

element.name: ColourSpace
element.documentation: Same value as in AVI (32 bits).

element.name: GammaValue
element.documentation: Gamma Value.

element.name: FrameRate
element.documentation: Number of frames per second. Informational only.

element.name: Colour
element.documentation: Settings describing the colour format.

element.name: MatrixCoefficients
element.documentation: The Matrix Coefficients of the video used to derive luma and chroma values from reg, green, and blue color primaries. For clarity, the value and meanings for MatrixCoefficients are adopted from Table 4 of ISO/IEC 23001-8:2013/DCOR1. (0:GBR, 1: BT709, 2: Unspecified, 3: Reserved, 4: FCC, 5: BT470BG, 6: SMPTE 170M, 7: SMPTE 240M, 8: YCOCG, 9: BT2020 Non-constant Luminance, 10: BT2020 Constant Luminance)

element.name: BitsPerChannel
element.documentation: Number of decoded bits per channel. A value of 0 indicates that the BitsPerChannel is unspecified.

element.name: ChromaSubsamplingHorz
element.documentation: The amount of pixels to remove in the Cr and Cb channels for every pixel not removed horizontally. Example: For video with 4:2:0 chroma subsampling, the ChromaSubsamplingHorz should be set to 1.

element.name: ChromaSubsamplingVert
element.documentation: The amount of pixels to remove in the Cr and Cb channels for every pixel not removed vertically. Example: For video with 4:2:0 chroma subsampling, the ChromaSubsamplingVert should be set to 1.

element.name: CbSubsamplingHorz
element.documentation: The amount of pixels to remove in the Cb channel for every pixel not removed horizontally. This is additive with ChromaSubsamplingHorz. Example: For video with 4:2:1 chroma subsampling, the ChromaSubsamplingHorz should be set to 1 and CbSubsamplingHorz should be set to 1.

element.name: CbSubsamplingVert
element.documentation: The amount of pixels to remove in the Cb channel for every pixel not removed vertically. This is additive with ChromaSubsamplingVert.

element.name: ChromaSitingHorz
element.documentation: How chroma is subsampled horizontally. (0: Unspecified, 1: Left Collocated, 2: Half)

element.name: ChromaSitingVert
element.documentation: How chroma is subsampled vertically. (0: Unspecified, 1: Top Collocated, 2: Half)

element.name: Range
element.documentation: Clipping of the color ranges. (0: Unspecified, 1: Broadcast Range, 2: Full range (no clipping), 3: Defined by MatrixCoefficients/TransferCharacteristics)

element.name: TransferCharacteristics
element.documentation: The transfer characteristics of the video. For clarity, the value and meanings for TransferCharacteristics 1-15 are adopted from Table 3 of ISO/IEC 23001-8:2013/DCOR1. TransferCharacteristics 16-18 are proposed values. (0: Reserved, 1: ITU-R BT.709, 2: Unspecified, 3: Reserved, 4: Gamma 2.2 curve, 5: Gamma 2.8 curve, 6: SMPTE 170M, 7: SMPTE 240M, 8: Linear, 9: Log, 10: Log Sqrt, 11: IEC 61966-2-4, 12: ITU-R BT.1361 Extended Colour Gamut, 13: IEC 61966-2-1, 14: ITU-R BT.2020 10 bit, 15: ITU-R BT.2020 12 bit, 16: SMPTE ST 2084, 17: SMPTE ST 428-1 18: ARIB STD-B67 (HLG))

element.name: Primaries
element.documentation: The colour primaries of the video. For clarity, the value and meanings for Primaries are adopted from Table 2 of ISO/IEC 23001-8:2013/DCOR1. (0: Reserved, 1: ITU-R BT.709, 2: Unspecified, 3: Reserved, 4: ITU-R BT.470M, 5: ITU-R BT.470BG, 6: SMPTE 170M, 7: SMPTE 240M, 8: FILM, 9: ITU-R BT.2020, 10: SMPTE ST 428-1, 22: JEDEC P22 phosphors)

element.name: MaxCLL
element.documentation: Maximum brightness of a single pixel (Maximum Content Light Level) in candelas per square meter (cd/m²).

element.name: MaxFALL
element.documentation: Maximum brightness of a single full frame (Maximum Frame-Average Light Level) in candelas per square meter (cd/m²).

element.name: MasteringMetadata
element.documentation: SMPTE 2086 mastering data.

element.name: PrimaryRChromaticityX
element.documentation: Red X chromaticity coordinate as defined by CIE 1931.

element.name: PrimaryRChromaticityY
element.documentation: Red Y chromaticity coordinate as defined by CIE 1931.

element.name: PrimaryGChromaticityX
element.documentation: Green X chromaticity coordinate as defined by CIE 1931.

element.name: PrimaryGChromaticityY
element.documentation: Green Y chromaticity coordinate as defined by CIE 1931.

element.name: PrimaryBChromaticityX
element.documentation: Blue X chromaticity coordinate as defined by CIE 1931.

element.name: PrimaryBChromaticityY
element.documentation: Blue Y chromaticity coordinate as defined by CIE 1931.

element.name: WhitePointChromaticityX
element.documentation: White X chromaticity coordinate as defined by CIE 1931.

element.name: WhitePointChromaticityY
element.documentation: White Y chromaticity coordinate as defined by CIE 1931.

element.name: LuminanceMax
element.documentation: Maximum luminance. Shall be represented in candelas per square meter (cd/m²).

element.name: LuminanceMin
element.documentation: Mininum luminance. Shall be represented in candelas per square meter (cd/m²).

element.name: Audio
element.documentation: Audio settings.

element.name: SamplingFrequency
element.documentation: Sampling frequency in Hz.

element.name: OutputSamplingFrequency
element.documentation: Real output sampling frequency in Hz (used for SBR techniques).

element.name: Channels
element.documentation: Numbers of channels in the track.

element.name: ChannelPositions
element.documentation: Table of horizontal angles for each successive channel, see appendix.

element.name: BitDepth
element.documentation: Bits per sample, mostly used for PCM.

element.name: TrackOperation
element.documentation: Operation that needs to be applied on tracks to create this virtual track. For more details look at the Specification Notes on the subject.

element.name: TrackCombinePlanes
element.documentation: Contains the list of all video plane tracks that need to be combined to create this 3D track

element.name: TrackPlane
element.documentation: Contains a video plane track that need to be combined to create this 3D track

element.name: TrackPlaneUID
element.documentation: The trackUID number of the track representing the plane.

element.name: TrackPlaneType
element.documentation: The kind of plane this track corresponds to (0: left eye, 1: right eye, 2: background).

element.name: TrackJoinBlocks
element.documentation: Contains the list of all tracks whose Blocks need to be combined to create this virtual track

element.name: TrackJoinUID
element.documentation: The trackUID number of a track whose blocks are used to create this virtual track.

element.name: ContentEncodings
element.documentation: Settings for several content encoding mechanisms like compression or encryption.

element.name: ContentEncoding
element.documentation: Settings for one content encoding like compression or encryption.

element.name: ContentEncodingOrder
element.documentation: Tells when this modification was used during encoding/muxing starting with 0 and counting upwards. The decoder/demuxer has to start with the highest order number it finds and work its way down. This value has to be unique over all ContentEncodingOrder Elements in the Segment.

element.name: ContentEncodingScope
element.documentation:
A bit field that describes which Elements have been modified in this way. Values (big endian) can be OR'ed. Possible values:
1 - all frame contents,
2 - the track's private data,
4 - the next ContentEncoding (next ContentEncodingOrder. Either the data inside ContentCompression and/or ContentEncryption)

element.name: ContentEncodingType
element.documentation:
A value describing what kind of transformation has been done. Possible values:
0 - compression,
1 - encryption

element.name: ContentCompression
element.documentation: Settings describing the compression used. Must be present if the value of ContentEncodingType is 0 and absent otherwise. Each block must be decompressable even if no previous block is available in order not to prevent seeking.

element.name: ContentCompAlgo
element.documentation:
The compression algorithm used. Algorithms that have been specified so far are:
0 - zlib,
1 - bzlib,
2 - lzo1x
3 - Header Stripping

element.name: ContentCompSettings
element.documentation: Settings that might be needed by the decompressor. For Header Stripping (ContentCompAlgo=3), the bytes that were removed from the beggining of each frames of the track.

element.name: ContentEncryption
element.documentation: Settings describing the encryption used. Must be present if the value of ContentEncodingType is 1 and absent otherwise.

element.name: ContentEncAlgo
element.documentation:
The encryption algorithm used. The value '0' means that the contents have not been encrypted but only signed. Predefined values:
1 - DES, 2 - 3DES, 3 - Twofish, 4 - Blowfish, 5 - AES

element.name: ContentEncKeyID
element.documentation: For public key algorithms this is the ID of the public key the the data was encrypted with.

element.name: ContentSignature
element.documentation: A cryptographic signature of the contents.

element.name: ContentSigKeyID
element.documentation: This is the ID of the private key the data was signed with.

element.name: ContentSigAlgo
element.documentation:
The algorithm used for the signature. A value of '0' means that the contents have not been signed but only encrypted. Predefined values:
1 - RSA

element.name: ContentSigHashAlgo
element.documentation:
The hash algorithm used for the signature. A value of '0' means that the contents have not been signed but only encrypted. Predefined values:
1 - SHA1-160
2 - MD5

element.name: Cues
element.documentation: A Top-Level Element to speed seeking access. All entries are local to the Segment. Should be mandatory for non "live" streams.

element.name: CuePoint
element.documentation: Contains all information relative to a seek point in the Segment.

element.name: CueTime
element.documentation: Absolute timestamp according to the Segment time base.

element.name: CueTrackPositions
element.documentation: Contain positions for different tracks corresponding to the timestamp.

element.name: CueTrack
element.documentation: The track for which a position is given.

element.name: CueClusterPosition
element.documentation: The position of the Cluster containing the required Block.

element.name: CueRelativePosition
element.documentation: The relative position of the referenced block inside the cluster with 0 being the first possible position for an Element inside that cluster.

element.name: CueDuration
element.documentation: The duration of the block according to the Segment time base. If missing the track's DefaultDuration does not apply and no duration information is available in terms of the cues.

element.name: CueBlockNumber
element.documentation: Number of the Block in the specified Cluster.

element.name: CueCodecState
element.documentation: The position of the Codec State corresponding to this Cue Element. 0 means that the data is taken from the initial Track Entry.

element.name: CueReference
element.documentation: The Clusters containing the required referenced Blocks.

element.name: CueRefTime
element.documentation: Timestamp of the referenced Block.

element.name: CueRefCluster
element.documentation: The Position of the Cluster containing the referenced Block.

element.name: CueRefNumber
element.documentation: Number of the referenced Block of Track X in the specified Cluster.

element.name: CueRefCodecState
element.documentation: The position of the Codec State corresponding to this referenced Element. 0 means that the data is taken from the initial Track Entry.

element.name: Attachments
element.documentation: Contain attached files.

element.name: AttachedFile
element.documentation: An attached file.

element.name: FileDescription
element.documentation: A human-friendly name for the attached file.

element.name: FileName
element.documentation: Filename of the attached file.

element.name: FileMimeType
element.documentation: MIME type of the file.

element.name: FileData
element.documentation: The data of the file.

element.name: FileUID
element.documentation: Unique ID representing the file, as random as possible.

element.name: FileReferral
element.documentation: A binary value that a track/codec can refer to when the attachment is needed.

element.name: Chapters
element.documentation: A system to define basic menus and partition data. For more detailed information, look at the Chapters Explanation.

element.name: EditionEntry
element.documentation: Contains all information about a Segment edition.

element.name: EditionUID
element.documentation: A unique ID to identify the edition. It's useful for tagging an edition.

element.name: EditionFlagHidden
element.documentation: If an edition is hidden (1), it should not be available to the user interface (but still to Control Tracks; see flag notes). (1 bit)

element.name: EditionFlagDefault
element.documentation: If a flag is set (1) the edition should be used as the default one. (1 bit)

element.name: EditionFlagOrdered
element.documentation: Specify if the chapters can be defined multiple times and the order to play them is enforced. (1 bit)

element.name: ChapterAtom
element.documentation: Contains the atom information to use as the chapter atom (apply to all tracks).

element.name: ChapterUID
element.documentation: A unique ID to identify the Chapter.

element.name: ChapterStringUID
element.documentation: A unique string ID to identify the Chapter. Use for WebVTT cue identifier storage.

element.name: ChapterTimeStart
element.documentation: Timestamp of the start of Chapter (not scaled).

element.name: ChapterTimeEnd
element.documentation: Timestamp of the end of Chapter (timestamp excluded, not scaled).

element.name: ChapterFlagHidden
element.documentation: If a chapter is hidden (1), it should not be available to the user interface (but still to Control Tracks; see flag notes). (1 bit)

element.name: ChapterFlagEnabled
element.documentation: Specify wether the chapter is enabled. It can be enabled/disabled by a Control Track. When disabled, the movie should skip all the content between the TimeStart and TimeEnd of this chapter (see flag notes). (1 bit)

element.name: ChapterSegmentUID
element.documentation: A Segment to play in place of this chapter. Edition ChapterSegmentEditionUID should be used for this Segment, otherwise no edition is used.

element.name: ChapterSegmentEditionUID
element.documentation: The EditionUID to play from the Segment linked in ChapterSegmentUID.

element.name: ChapterPhysicalEquiv
element.documentation: Specify the physical equivalent of this ChapterAtom like "DVD" (60) or "SIDE" (50), see complete list of values.

element.name: ChapterTrack
element.documentation: List of tracks on which the chapter applies. If this Element is not present, all tracks apply

element.name: ChapterTrackNumber
element.documentation: UID of the Track to apply this chapter too. In the absense of a control track, choosing this chapter will select the listed Tracks and deselect unlisted tracks. Absense of this Element indicates that the Chapter should be applied to any currently used Tracks.

element.name: ChapterDisplay
element.documentation: Contains all possible strings to use for the chapter display.

element.name: ChapString
element.documentation: Contains the string to use as the chapter atom.

element.name: ChapLanguage
element.documentation: The languages corresponding to the string, in the bibliographic ISO-639-2 form.

element.name: ChapCountry
element.documentation: The countries corresponding to the string, same 2 octets as in Internet domains.

element.name: ChapProcess
element.documentation: Contains all the commands associated to the Atom.

element.name: ChapProcessCodecID
element.documentation: Contains the type of the codec used for the processing. A value of 0 means native Matroska processing (to be defined), a value of 1 means the DVD command set is used. More codec IDs can be added later.

element.name: ChapProcessPrivate
element.documentation: Some optional data attached to the ChapProcessCodecID information. For ChapProcessCodecID = 1, it is the "DVD level" equivalent.

element.name: ChapProcessCommand
element.documentation: Contains all the commands associated to the Atom.

element.name: ChapProcessTime
element.documentation: Defines when the process command should be handled (0: during the whole chapter, 1: before starting playback, 2: after playback of the chapter).

element.name: ChapProcessData
element.documentation: Contains the command information. The data should be interpreted depending on the ChapProcessCodecID value. For ChapProcessCodecID = 1, the data correspond to the binary DVD cell pre/post commands.

element.name: Tags
element.documentation: Element containing Elements specific to Tracks/Chapters. A list of valid tags can be found here.

element.name: Tag
element.documentation: Element containing Elements specific to Tracks/Chapters.

element.name: Targets
element.documentation: Contain all UIDs where the specified meta data apply. It is empty to describe everything in the Segment.

element.name: TargetTypeValue
element.documentation: A number to indicate the logical level of the target (see TargetType).

element.name: TargetType
element.documentation: An informational string that can be used to display the logical level of the target like "ALBUM", "TRACK", "MOVIE", "CHAPTER", etc (see TargetType).

element.name: TagTrackUID
element.documentation: A unique ID to identify the Track(s) the tags belong to. If the value is 0 at this level, the tags apply to all tracks in the Segment.

element.name: TagEditionUID
element.documentation: A unique ID to identify the EditionEntry(s) the tags belong to. If the value is 0 at this level, the tags apply to all editions in the Segment.

element.name: TagChapterUID
element.documentation: A unique ID to identify the Chapter(s) the tags belong to. If the value is 0 at this level, the tags apply to all chapters in the Segment.

element.name: TagAttachmentUID
element.documentation: A unique ID to identify the Attachment(s) the tags belong to. If the value is 0 at this level, the tags apply to all the attachments in the Segment.

element.name: SimpleTag
element.documentation: Contains general information about the target.

element.name: TagName
element.documentation: The name of the Tag that is going to be stored.

element.name: TagLanguage
element.documentation: Specifies the language of the tag specified, in the Matroska languages form.

element.name: TagDefault
element.documentation: Indication to know if this is the default/original language to use for the given tag. (1 bit)

element.name: TagString
element.documentation: The value of the Tag.

element.name: TagBinary
element.documentation: The values of the Tag if it is binary. Note that this cannot be used in the same SimpleTag as TagString.
